channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How Claude Became a Co-Founder
item.description: Anthropic’s Claude has reshaped the code-writing business and fueled a billion-dollar AI boom.

item.title: Exelon CEO: The ‘warning lights are on’ for U.S. electric grid resilience and utility prices amid AI demand surge
item.description: The U.S. needs more generation, including renewables, and greater efficiencies to keep the grid from breaking down Exelon CEO and President Calvin But...

item.title: The problem with ‘human in the loop’ AI? Often, it’s the humans

item.title: Jamie Dimon taps Jeff Bezos, Michael Dell and Ford CEO Jim Farley to advise JPMorgan’s $1.5 trillion national-security initiative
item.description: Former military commanders, politicians, and one of Warren Buffet’s top stock pickers also comprise the advisory group.

item.title: Home insurance rates have gone up for 6 million people. How climate change and Trump are making the affordability crisis worse
item.description: If your home insurance rate has spiked lately, you’re not alone. And President Trump’s policies could make it even more expensive. Since 2021, at leas...

item.title: 6 Lessons from Latinas in Hollywood for Corporate America
item.description: Representation, authenticity, and community are key.

item.title: Job openings barely improved in October, hitting 7.7 million
item.description: U.S. job openings barely budged in October, coming in at 7.7 million with ongoing uncertainty over the direction of the American economy . The Labor D...

item.title: ‘Customers don’t care about AI’ — they just want to boost cash flow and make ends meet, Intuit CEO says
item.description: "A business is trying to get more customers. They're trying to manage their customers, sell them more services."

item.title: This Founder Says the FDA’s Withdrawal of an Important Safety Rule Is Putting Consumers at Risk
item.description: The rule involves talc, asbestos, and the health of people using beauty products.

item.title: How the Founders of Bogg Bag and Glowbar Predict the Future
item.description: On the latest episode of Your Next Move: How two successful founders leverage business forecasting to stay ahead of the curve.

item.title: Student loans could resume for millions as Trump administration moves to end SAVE pause

item.title: ‘Fodder for a recession’: Top economist Mark Zandi warns about so many Americans ‘already living on the financial edge’ in the K-shaped economy
item.description: The latest JOLTS report shows hiring stuck at 3.2% and quits falling again as the Fed prepares to cut rates.

item.title: PepsiCo to cut prices and 20% of products under a new deal

item.description: There’s at least one reported success story so far.
